onset.Description: Start time of the event relative to the beginning of the recording in seconds.

duration.Description: Duration of the event in seconds.

Levels.bckg: Refers to an epoch of data that does not contain an epileptic seizure.
Levels.sz: Referring to a seizure type that cannot be described by the ILAE 2017 classification either because of inadequate information or unusual clinical features.
Levels.sz_foc:: Focal seizure with unknown or unreported awareness
Levels.sz_foc_a_m_automatisms: Focal aware motor seizure with automatisms (more or less coordinated, purposeless, repetitive motor activity)
Levels.sz_foc_a_m_atonic: Focal aware motor seizure with atonic activity (focal loss of tone)
Levels.sz_foc_a_m_clonic: Focal aware motor seizure with clonic activity (focal rhythmic jerking)
Levels.sz_foc_a_m_spasms: Focal aware motor seizure with spasms
Levels.sz_foc_a_m_hyperkinetic: Focal aware motor seizure with hyperkinetic activity (pedaling, thrashing)
Levels.sz_foc_a_m_myoclonic: Focal aware motor seizure with myoclonic activity (irregular, brief focal jerking)
Levels.sz_foc_a_m_tonic: Focal aware motor seizure with tonic activity (sustained focal stiffening)
Levels.sz_foc_a_nm_autonomic: Focal aware non-motor seizure with autonomic effects such as gastrointestinal sensations, a sense of heat or cold, flushing, piloerection (goosebumps), palpitations, sexual arousal, respiratory changes, or other autonomic effects
Levels.sz_foc_a_nm_behavior: Focal aware non-motor seizure with behavior arrest involving cessation of movement and unresponsiveness as the predominant aspect of the entire seizure.
Levels.sz_foc_a_nm_cognitive: Focal aware non-motor seizure with cognitive disfunction such as deficits in language, thinking or associated higher cortical functions
Levels.sz_foc_a_nm_emotional: Focal aware non-motor seizure with emotional arrest
Levels.sz_foc_a_nm_sensory: Focal aware non-motor seizure with somatosensory, olfactory, visual, auditory, gustatory, hot–cold sense, or vestibular sensations
Levels.sz_foc_a_um: Focal aware seizure with unknown or unreported motor clinical features
Levels.sz_foc_ia_m_automatisms: Focal impaired-awareness motor seizure with automatisms (more or less coordinated, purposeless, repetitive motor activity)
Levels.sz_foc_ia_m_atonic: Focal impaired-awareness motor seizure with atonic activity (focal loss of tone)
Levels.sz_foc_ia_m_clonic: Focal impaired-awareness motor seizure with clonic activity (focal rhythmic jerking)
Levels.sz_foc_ia_m_spasms: Focal impaired-awareness motor seizure with spasms
Levels.sz_foc_ia_m_hyperkinetic: Focal impaired-awareness motor seizure with hyperkinetic activity (pedaling, thrashing)
Levels.sz_foc_ia_m_myoclonic: Focal impaired-awareness motor seizure with myoclonic activity (irregular, brief focal jerking)
Levels.sz_foc_ia_m_tonic: Focal impaired-awareness motor seizure with tonic activity (sustained focal stiffening)
Levels.sz_foc_ia_nm_autonomic: Focal impaired-awareness non-motor seizure with autonomic effects such as gastrointestinal sensations, a sense of heat or cold, flushing, piloerection (goosebumps), palpitations, sexual arousal, respiratory changes, or other autonomic effects
Levels.sz_foc_ia_nm_behavior: Focal impaired-awareness non-motor seizure with behavior arrest involving cessation of movement and unresponsiveness as the predominant aspect of the entire seizure.
Levels.sz_foc_ia_nm_cognitive: Focal impaired-awareness non-motor seizure with cognitive disfunction such as deficits in language, thinking or associated higher cortical functions
Levels.sz_foc_ia_nm_emotional: Focal impaired-awareness non-motor seizure with emotional arrest
Levels.sz_foc_ia_nm_sensory: Focal impaired-awareness non-motor seizure with somatosensory, olfactory, visual, auditory, gustatory, hot–cold sense, or vestibular sensations
Levels.sz_foc_ia_um: Focal impaired-awareness seizure with unknown or unreported motor clinical features
Levels.sz_foc_ua_m_automatisms: Focal unknown-awareness motor seizure with automatisms (more or less coordinated, purposeless, repetitive motor activity)
Levels.sz_foc_ua_m_atonic: Focal unknown-awareness motor seizure with atonic activity (focal loss of tone)
Levels.sz_foc_ua_m_clonic: Focal unknown-awareness motor seizure with clonic activity (focal rhythmic jerking)
Levels.sz_foc_ua_m_spasms: Focal unknown-awareness motor seizure with spasms
Levels.sz_foc_ua_m_hyperkinetic: Focal unknown-awareness motor seizure with hyperkinetic activity (pedaling, thrashing)
Levels.sz_foc_ua_m_myoclonic: Focal unknown-awareness motor seizure with myoclonic activity (irregular, brief focal jerking)
Levels.sz_foc_ua_m_tonic: Focal unknown-awareness motor seizure with tonic activity (sustained focal stiffening)
Levels.sz_foc_ua_nm_autonomic: Focal unknown-awareness non-motor seizure with autonomic effects such as gastrointestinal sensations, a sense of heat or cold, flushing, piloerection (goosebumps), palpitations, sexual arousal, respiratory changes, or other autonomic effects
Levels.sz_foc_ua_nm_behavior: Focal unknown-awareness non-motor seizure with behavior arrest involving cessation of movement and unresponsiveness as the predominant aspect of the entire seizure.
Levels.sz_foc_ua_nm_cognitive: Focal unknown-awareness non-motor seizure with cognitive disfunction such as deficits in language, thinking or associated higher cortical functions
Levels.sz_foc_ua_nm_emotional: Focal unknown-awareness non-motor seizure with emotional arrest
Levels.sz_foc_ua_nm_sensory: Focal unknown-awareness non-motor seizure with somatosensory, olfactory, visual, auditory, gustatory, hot–cold sense, or vestibular sensations
Levels.sz_foc_ua_um: Focal unknown-awareness seizure with unknown or unreported motor clinical features
Levels.sz_foc_f2b: Focal onset seizure that propagates to a bilateral tonic–clonic seizure
Levels.sz_gen_m_clonic: Generalized clonic seizure (begin, progress, and end with sustained rhythmic jerking of limbs on both sides of the body and often head, neck, face, and trunk)
Levels.sz_gen_m_tonic: Generalized tonic seizure (bilateral limb stiffening or elevation, often with neck stiffening). The classification presumes that the tonic activity is not followed by clonic movements.
Levels.sz_gen_m_myoTC: Generalized myoclonic–tonic–clonic seizure (begin with a few myoclonic jerks followed by tonic–clonic activity)
Levels.sz_gen_m_myoAtonic: Generalized myoclonic–atonic seizure (brief jerking of limbs or trunk, followed by a limp drop)
Levels.sz_gen_nm: Generalized seizure with no motor activity (varieties of absence seizures)
Levels.sz_gen_nm_atypical: Atypical absence seizure (associated with changes in tone that are more pronounced than in typical absence or the onset or cessation is not abrupt)
Levels.sz_gen_nm_myoclonic: Myoclonic absence seizure (rhythmic three-per-second myoclonic movements)
Levels.sz_gen_nm_eyelidMyio: Absence seizure with eyelid myoclonia (myoclonic jerks of the eyelids and upward deviation of the eyes, often precipitated by closing the eyes or by light)
Levels.sz_uo: Seizure with unknown or unreported onset
Levels.sz_uo_m: Motor seizure with unknown or unreported onset
Levels.sz_uo_m_tonicClonic: Tonic-clonic seizure with unknown or unreported onset
Levels.sz_uo_m_spasms: Seizure with unknown or unreported onset with spasms
Levels.sz_uo_nm: Non-motor seizure with unknown or unreported onset
Levels.sz_uo_nm_behavior: Non-motor seizure with behavioural activity and unknown or unreported onset

confidence.Description: Confidence of the event label in the range 0-1. The value can be provided by the humand annotator or an automated machine learning annotator

channels.Description: EEG channels on which the event is visible

recordingDuration.Description: Duration of the recording in seconds
